episodes.title: Distinguishing Between a Cult's Narrative from the True Narrative
episodes.description:
For many years I found it difficult to trust myself. The cult spends countless hours telling the members that they are all bad and that the leaders and founder are super holy. While they said that all they were doing was good, I couldn't help but feel confused because deep inside my heart I felt like something was wrong. But like I said, we weren't allowed to trust our own intuitions or make our own decisions.
For a few years even after leaving the cult I still felt bound by their narratives that those who leave are good for nothing and misfits in this world. But after some deep thinking and soul searching I began to see through the lies and the false narratives that the cult had been feeding me throughout all those years.
As soon as I was able to separate the cults narrative from the truth, I was able to better understand what happened to me and from there know myself a lot better, and love myself for who I truly am.

episodes.title: Why It's Hard To Talk After Leaving A Cult
episodes.description:
In this video I talk about the difficulty I encountered after leaving the cult to open up and talk about the negative experiences. Inside of that environment we were told to stay away from any negative commentary and to view ex members, or even current members who were struggling, as enemies.
It was with that fear in mind that I had a hard time to openly talk about it.
But here I am talking about it. It took me a long time to get here and here I am :)

episodes.title: Let's Talk About Cult and Religious Trauma. Why it's Hard to Talk About
episodes.description:
In this episode I wanted to talk about cult and religious trauma and also open up about why I didn't talk about it for so long.
Sadly there was a lot of shame involved and I felt that by talking about it I would be cursed and would lose a lot of friendships.
Repressing the experiences didn't feel good but I thought, at the time, that it was the healthiest thing for me to do.
It was only after I went through therapy and found ways to express my story that I started to grow authentically.

episodes.title: Exposing Cult Reality with Rosie Rodriguez @shewokeup_exjw7680
episodes.description:
From Rosie:
About Me
Rosie was born in Southern California

Come from large family on both sides of my parents and step parents.

I am German and indigenous Mexico descendant.

59 years old

Have/ had 2 children,
Lost a son, he was sixteen and my mother at a double homicide in 2002.

My mother and step father raised me Baptist and non denominational, but went to pentecostal with my neighbor friends.

Mom taught me religious biblical texts.

As an young 20 year old I started searching for truth. Some sort of religion to save me from abuse I endured at the hands of my step father. My brother and myself had endured to be more exact. My mother was emotionally abused.

I went to many other denominations before Jehovahs witnesses.

In 1985 I study books and Bible with Jehovahs witnesses. I thought they were decent people and they taught me God hates violence.
32 years later, I learned that misogyny, hidden child abuse, domestic violence wS permitted in that organization. Victims were told to not tell anyone of any abuse and bible says you have to stay with abusers.

However, for me I escaped 3 times because I didn't agree. I almost died at the hand of my children's father. 1987.

Over the years from my 20's, 30's, 40's and early 50's I would leave Jws, go back, leave, go back. .
But as of today sine 2019 my journey has stopped completely with Jehovahs Witnesses. 

The only Journey I have now is freedom from a controlling cult since 2019.

I can choose dreams and goals with no guilt if displeasing there god that punishes all who don't conform.

I look at our lives, my life as a beautiful flowing river.
Each flow of water moves and turns in the bends of a river. Sometimes a river slows or trickles along the way until the next strong rain fall.
All the movement in a free flowing river is my life. When a log or large rocks are in the flow of the river, it's my life and the obstacles or change of path that I need to choose to move. Over rocks or large boulders are just what water does, it flows over, around and under to keep moving.
My healing journey from childhood abuse and religious abuse was the large boulders in my path of life. 
At times my river of life did not flow well. It stopped if my decisions were not the best. But once I realized I had to keep moving, nothing could stand in my way.
 I choose to help others to keep moving on there river of life. 
That's why I started sharing some of my life on different forms.
I love to share kind and caring  words to help others. 

We cannot stop living because others try to suppress who we are.

Our lives are beutiful, we have and can have a free flowing spirit within. 

I have seen in my travels, especially Oregon,...great beauty. And, large rivers make me feel alive. They shimmer in the sun. Life flurishes in a beautiful free flowing body of water.

When we recognize in ourselves, " Hey I need to heal," then that person who was in pain releases that block of large boulders from our lives, then the living starts again.

Just looking at life in that perspective has Givin me a more renewed sense of loving. Nature in all it's glory can teach us to live again, no matter what part in our life has slowed down, or is trickling slowly....it can come alive again, it will start moving once we can and will decide to journey on and not let obstacles keep us down.

Life is to precious to stop living.
 Leave your logs and rapids and water falls behind. Start your river again, let it shine and let life begin.

Rosie Rodriguez

episodes.description: Vennie Kocsis was born into a Naval family, beginning her life with a childhood filled with adventure and exploration as her father retired from the Navy and went to work for Northrup Grumman. However, her idyllic years came to an abrupt end when her mother was lured into an evangelical cult known as Sam Fife’s Move of God. In the episode, Vennie shares the harsh conditions she grew up in and the journey into recovering from the terror that was her childhood. episodes.title: Healing and Growing after Childhood Trauma with Lisa Tickel @lisamtickel
episodes.description:
Lisa Tickel, a resilient childhood abuse survivor, is on an inspiring healing journey, dedicated to breaking free from her past shadows and paving the way for a brighter future. Her unwavering determination and inner strength have transformed her into a powerful advocate for others, inspiring and empowering others on their own paths to healing.
 
Lisa has launched the empowering podcast “Healing & Growing, Hand in Hand.” Her primary purpose behind creating this podcast is to help others “shorten their pain.” Drawing from her own personal experiences, Lisa bravely shares stories of abuse and healing, fostering a safe environment for others to openly discuss their challenges and successes. Esteemed experts and practitioners come together on this transformative platform, providing valuable advice and resources for personal healing and growth. Moreover, the podcast raises awareness about lesser-known or overlooked areas of abuse and trauma within the community, shedding light on their gravity and impact.
 
Beyond the mic, she cherishes moments with her blended family. She and her husband enjoy going on long walks or hikes with her two dogs, Ace & Blackjack. She enjoys spending time her friends, working in her garden or cooking up a new recipe.

episodes.title: Interviewing a psychiatrist #psychiatry #doctor #therapy #frasier #sitcom #review #mentalhealth
How to Talk to a Loved One in a Cult
episodes.description:
Lately I've been reflecting a lot on how I felt when speaking outsiders during my years inside of the AHFI cult.
I didn't know that I was in a cult but I did sense that something was wrong.
After years of brainwashing I found it difficult to pinpoint what exactly was wrong.
There are two different personal experiences that I share in this episode.
The first is when I reached out to a priest in Los Angeles and how little I felt after he yelled at me for being inside the AHFI cult.
The second experience I talk about is from my time in Brooklyn when I reached out to another priest and was treated with kindness, compassion, and felt welcomed.
Upon leaving the cult I looked back at these two instances and weighed how my emotions felt after each experience.
In this episode it is my hope that by sharing my story that people may have a bit of understanding on how to talk to a loved one who is still stuck inside of a cult.

episodes.description:
Welcome to The Truth That Heals Podcast!
This episode seeks to understand the importance of taking care of our mental health as well as the role psychiatry has in assisting people to getting the help they need.
Joining me for today's episode is Dr. Rebecca Allen who walks us through what the process is like to becoming a psychiatrist, what depression looks like, and we even get to talk about a few movies and tv shows, and more!

In the latter part of the interview we steer the discussion towards a different direction.

As a survivor of an End Times Cult it was important for me to ask a few questions regarding some of the behaviors I witnessed inside the cult and to hear an expert's thoughts on the matter.

This was an enjoyable interview for me as a podcaster and very eye/mind opening.

episodes.title: Embracing My Healing Journey after leaving the cult
episodes.description:
Trying to rediscover life was terrifying in the beginning. Not being able to talk about it (cult/religious abuse) due to things like guilt and shame were additional burdens that I had been carrying.
Over time I found the courage to speak, allowing myself to heal, and to be able to forgive myself.
The cult life taught us to look down on ourselves and to only look up to the leadership.
Now, with positive influences in my life, I can look back over the last few years and see how much progress I’ve made… and it’s beautiful. 🙂

Was I Trafficked by the AHFI Cult?
episodes.description: Over the years I tried ignoring all of the red flags. Everything was the fault of the members. But then I started to open my eyes and became aware of what happened to me. The fraud. The manipulation. The fear. And so for today's episode I want to talk about trafficking that I believe I experienced. Many will say that I wasn't trafficked and that I chose that life. The truth is many of us couldn't leave. The superiors of the group held onto our passports and other important documents to make sure that we wouldn't leave and some ex members even had their visas ripped out of their passports to keep them from leaving. Some will say that I wasn't being trafficked. I say I was trafficked. What do you say?  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support
subjects: Alliance of the Holy Family International

episodes.title: Finding Light After Darkness. Healing After Abuse. Interview with Twana Lawler
episodes.description: In today's episode on The Truth That Heals Podcast I was able to listen to the powerful story of Twana Lawler. She is a strong woman who was has faced lots of pain and suffering in this life. But that hasn't stopped her from trying to live the best life that she can. episodes.title: The Difficulties of Leaving an End Times Cult and Finding Healing
episodes.description: Once you are in an End Times Cult it's as if you have been frozen in time. All you look forward to are persecutions and THE END. After being inside for so long I finally found my freedom however I soon discovered that I still felt trapped. I felt like a prisoner and a part of me wanted to go back to the cult. I didn't have any life skills. I didn't have any idea of what the real world was like. I was trained, or programmed, to look at education and relationships as something toxic. It took quite a while for me to untangle my thoughts from the lies and to finally break free and find peace with life in the outside world. While I thought I was preparing for the end I now look back and think how controlling the community leaders were to the point that we had to see abuse as a gift from God, or as a reflection of God's infinite love.I want to share my story as well as the dirty side of my story such as the depression, the loneliness, the heartaches, so that the viewer may understand what life is like for someone who has left an end times cult. Not everyone went through what I experienced however I am sure that there are many who left not knowing what to do with their life. Feeling like you were hated by God, hated by the community, and that your life was damned. If the cult leaders are in charge of the narrative you will only see doom and gloom. It is my hope that survivors of cult abuse, of abuse within a Catholic Community that pretends to follow Christ while beating the members, it is my hope that survivors take back the narrative and live their life with peace. These cult leaders even wounded my religious faith nonetheless I have been on a path towards healing, forgiveness, love, and courage.To support my journey and my channel check out my links:Linktree: https://linktr.ee/truththathealspodPatreon: https://www.patreon.com/Truththathealspodcast/posts  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.title: A Discussion On Purity Culture
episodes.description: Purity Culture has been coming up a lot lately in my quest to understand life, religion, trauma, and healing. To get a better understanding of what this culture was like I sat down and discussed this theme with Erin so that my understanding of it would be clearer. We talked about some of the good things regarding purity, but, we also talked about the things that many don't want to be talked about, or, the dark side of purity culture. While many may think that Purity Culture only focuses on staying virgin one will begin to see that there is a lot of judgement and shaming in this environment. Also, in many instances, the youth are being formed to look upon the body as something dirty. Many who are brought up in the system of purity have neglected other Christian virtues such as patience and kindness. Also, there seems to be a strong rush to condemn and beat down on those who don't reach the standards of purity which opens the door for shame and at times even trauma depending on the scenario.  Check out my links and please support my channel. Like, Subscribe, and please share as this all helps me to grow! Thank you!   https://linktr.ee/truththathealspod?utm_source=linktree_profile_share

episodes.title: The Cult's Views on Purity and Control
episodes.description: One of the hardest things for me to do is to breakdown the story of my cult experience in a way that is not complicated or all over the place. My journey inside the cult has been difficult at times to talk about, even to this day, but for me to tell my story I believe that it is best to simplify things to make the cult experience understandable for those who were not members. In no way is this episode an attempt to bash those who seek to live a life of purity and who cherish the chaste life. Not at all. Instead I simply wish to shed light on how the cult and leaders used purity as a way to bring guilt, control, and even fear upon members. It was even used as a tactic to recruit members by telling young adults that if they didn't "try God first they would regret it." Hopefully by listening to this episode people, including former cult members, will understand that there was a lot of abuse of power as well as terrible spiritual direction on the part of some of the superiors within the group. It is my desire by sharing my story that people will understand what we went through and that if there are people who feel guilt or shame from the experience may find freedom from the psychological, and at times physical, torture we endured. episodes.title: Interview with Andrew Pledger: Healing from Religious Trauma
episodes.description: Today's Guest: Andrew Pledger Bio  Andrew Pledger is a survivor, creator, and activist who uses social media to share his story and inspire others. He is a religious trauma survivor homeschooled K-12 and raised in a fundamentalist Christian cult (Independent Fundamental Baptist movement). He brings awareness to spiritual and religious abuse. Being a part of the LGBTQ+ community and experiencing religious trauma has inspired him to pursue psychology to help survivors. After being homeschooled, he found his way to Bob Jones University. He attended the fundamentalist Christian college for over three years until he was expelled in his last semester for sharing his story and denouncing fundamentalist teachings. He has a limited podcast premiering soon called "Surviving Bob Jones University: A Christian Cult." This podcast explores the school's history, the psychology of fundamentalism, the criteria for cults, and survivors' experiences. He also hosts his regular podcast, "Speaking Up w/ Andrew Pledger" which features interviews with experts and survivors of cults and high-control religions. episodes.title: The Cult of Fr. Bing: Trying to Identify the Cult Movement
episodes.description:
As a former OATH member I witnessed a split in the group. On the one hand I saw the side of the members who wanted to practice their faith peacefully and on the other side I saw the development of cult tactics, bullying, paranoia and manipulation, as well as beatings.
In this episode I seek to find a name for the group that I was in. It is so difficult for me, a member of the OATH for 11 years, to truly identify the name. I can't say its all AHFI because the AHFI members did not live with Fr. Bing or the other superiors as I did.
Once the Vatican got involved and freed us from slavery under Fr. Bing I saw a freedom that I had never seen before in the group.
The OATH (one of the six institutes founded by Fr. Bing outside of the AHFI yet still connected with the AHFI) and a few other institutes decided to follow the changes brought upon by Rome, the Vatican, and one of those changes was the removal of Fr. Bing and his loyalists from being in charge and holding all the power.
From what I witnessed, the SITH, under the leadership of Anges Frias, who was a big bully to me and others, decided not to follow those changes by the Vatican and instead follow Fr. Bing all while not being transparent to the members nor being totally transparent to the AHFI members and the family members.
Today the OATH and the LIHM are institutes that I respect because they freed themselves from the culty grip of Bing and Agnes and from what I understand, are even treating the members with dignity and respect.
As for the SITH members, or whatever they call themselves today, I am greatly concerned because of how abusive and mean I remember Agnes Frias was. Then with Fr. Bing and his extreme paranoia... you never know exactly what he will do next. But for sure he will always find a way to make himself the victim of the story.
So what is the name of the group? They have so many names so I am just gonna call it The Bing Movement Cult to sum it all up. All the different names makes the whole thing so much more confusing. Or should it be called The Cult of Bing Arellano? I dont know

episodes.title: Owning Yourself and Who You Are with Claire Millane
episodes.description: Welcome back! For this episode I am joined by Claire Millane to talk about the importance of owning yourself and who you are despite the difficulties which may arise in life. She's an actor, writer, filmmaker and newbie stand-up comedian. She's Dublin based but originally from County Galway in the West of Ireland. She's experienced a lot of ups and downs throughout the years including mountains of failure. She even failed her driving test...before she left the centre. But it hasn't been all bad. She's also met some amazing people, experienced a lot of laughs, had the craic (of the Irish kind) and had some successes along the way. Comedy and creativity transformed Claire's life and in the tough times they've been the two things that have gotten her through. You can find her on Youtube here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLCh-cVs4pPbOGsCEgYTfJw  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.title: Healing from Childhood Trauma and life after leaving the Mormon Church with Angie Berrett Pt. 2
episodes.description: Angie Berrett (she/they) is an Intuitive Movement Coach, Registered Nurse, Advanced Trauma Informed Yoga Instructor and Stand-Up Paddleboard Yoga Instructor who understands  the human body and how it works. She helps people relieve stress, anxiety, depression and trauma through play, movements and fun so they can have healing and peace in their lives.    After going from child abuse survivor to registered nurse to yoga instructor, she has spent much of her life caring for others. In 2017 she hit rock bottom and started  on a journey to heal.  Discovering playful ways of using movements helped her learn to listen to her body, overcoming her suffering in ways traditional modalities could not. Now, she helps others heal their pain, transforming their lives.    She is the Owner and Creator of Angie Berrett Movement, coaching people how to release stored trauma in their bodies while increasing energy, strength and  flexibility.  For her expertise, she has been featured in Psychology  Today, Authority  Magazine, Bustle, Subkit, The  Feisty News and NewsBreak. https://angieberrettmovement.com/ https://www.linkedin.com/in/angieberrettmovement/ https://Instagram.com/angieberrettmovement https://twitter.com/AngieBerrett  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.title: My Battles with Thought Reform and Brainwashing
episodes.description: In today's episode I give details how we were trained to die to ourselves and to no longer think freely. Free Will no longer existed. The only thing that existed was the Community. There was no I in the community. I break down the battles I had to go through when trying to leave and how hard it was to pierce through all of the brainwashing from over the years. I held on to the smallest bit of hope and that has helped me get through the darkest thoughts. episodes.title: Pushing my Limits with Purpose
episodes.description: Hey y'all! It's been a while since I last did a podcast. As your can hear from my voice I am so rusty and nervous but I felt that it was time to get back to doing something which I find to be exciting. Not long ago my father passed away. I always looked up to him and seeing him helpless on his deathbed sort of woke me up on the need to give life my best and to follow my dad's example of putting love in everything he did.  At the end of this episode I put a challenge on my listeners to try to practice doing an act of love throughout the day or throughout the week. I'm still new at this so please be patient as I work on my podcast speaking skills. Thank you for listening :)  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.description: I am joined today by cult expert Dr. Janja Lalich. Leaving the cult life had left me feeling wounded, lost, confused, and at times even feeling shame. Dr. Janja Lalich really breaks down the ways my experience was culty and she also gives hope that healing and recovery is possible. For more information you can check out her website here:  http://janjalalich.com/  http://www.tbylr.com/   Janja Lalich, Ph.D. Professor Emerita of Sociology Founder, Center for Research on Cults and Coercion Co-Founder, Take Back Your Life Recovery, LLC International Authority on Cults & Coercion  Order a copy of her book Take Back Your Life: Recovering from Cults and Abusive Relationships 📸: photo credit: Robert Palumbo  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.title: The TRUE meaning of Consent with Joyce Short and Nina Lucas
episodes.description: In today’s episode we will be learning the true meaning of consent to avoid confusion and to protect ourselves. As a survivor of cult tactics and manipulation one of the biggest hurts I had was the thought that I had consented to allowing the craziness to happen to me. Joyce and Nina helped me to see the deception that happened and to understand that I never gave full consent. #FGKIA FREELY GIVEN, KNOWLEDGEABLE, and INFORMED AGREEMENT. For more information here are a few links:  http://consentawareness.net/  https://www.change.org/p/supporting-bill-a6540a-and-s6200a-to-define-consent-in-penal-law?redirect=false   https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=imr5ZiAY_ao&t=19s https://alittlebitculty.com/episode/fgkia-joyce-short-nina-lucas-on-defining-consent  https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2022/08/26/spain-only-yes-law-sexual-consent/   Joyce Short IG @yourconsent Nina Lucas IG @standfirmvoice  Amazon Link for Your Consent: The Key to Conquering Sexual Assault https://www.amazon.com/Your-Consent-Conquering-Sexual-Assault-ebook/dp/B07N1CXDCC/ref=nodl_?dplnkId=63e49c51-1b0f-4382-8221-ebfbeb0b1685  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.title: Ways Religious Abuse was Justified in my Experience
episodes.description: Have you ever been in a cult? Or in a religious community that took things way too far that abuses were allowed and at times even justified? Today I share two ways in which I saw abuses getting justified as being for a greater good. I am not a expert or doctor of psychology or anything like that however in this podcast I simply share what my experiences were after living in a cult environment for over a decade. The ways religious abuse was justified in my environment might not be what you have experienced however I feel it is necessary for me to share my story so that these forms of manipulation can be discovered sooner.   ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.title: Loving Your Genuine Self: Healing After Trauma with Claudia M. Villanueva
episodes.description: In today's episode with Claudia Moreno Villanueva I open up about some of the verbal abuse that I and other members had gone through and the process that needs to start in order for healing to happen. For me it was a mixture of verbal abuse, religious bullying and harassment, manipulation and shaming. After speaking with Claudia I felt so much resilience within me and a new sense of hope. It had been a long journey and I am still trying my best to love my genuine self. I thank God for sending me friends like Claudia M. Villanueva who have aided me so much with my journey towards full recovery. If you would like to learn more about Claudia and the work that she does you can find her on Instagram @higherloveSA_anxietycoaching or on FB @ Overcoming Panic Attacks with Higher Love Life Coaching  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.title: Exorcisms in a Cult/Religious Community and Mental Health
episodes.description: The Catholic Church has protocols in place to make sure that exorcisms are done carefully and with much respect to the person in need of deliverance. In today's episode I want to share my experience of having exorcisms done on me and the rest of the members in a bizarre way and how the founder, in his cult like ways, used exorcism at his own whim instead of following the proper protocols which have been put in place by the Church. Unfortunately, many mental issues would be dismissed and they would label everything as a spiritual issue instead.  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.title: Calling For Transparency of a Cult
episodes.description: There are so many dark areas in cults. I joined a religious community in 2004 and was there for 11 years. I thought I was just joining a good religious community until I discovered after leaving that in fact the way some superiors ran the show was very cult like. The side that wanted to do things the right way are being very transparent and are working on doing things the right way and I applaud them for their endeavors. The side that went with Fr. Bing however are still in the dark and are unable to see the lack of transparency of the Founder. Fr. Bing, it is high time that you make a public apology, along with other members who were abusive as well to do the same. You have the power to do something good in this life and it starts with being transparent and apologize in public.  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

The other member tried to shame me and put me down which resulted in me putting my foot down that his behavior towards me would not be tolerated anymore. Towards the end of this podcast I call out the members who have been cult like by brainwashing their members and manipulating people that they come clean and be transparent with the church and with the people instead of always running or making up stories. The truth needs to come out.  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.title: Beaten but not Broken
episodes.description: In this episode I talk about the current journey I am on when it comes to healing and the long road that I have been on over the years. Sadly, many victims of abuse are silenced and shamed. I want to bring hope by sharing my journey and the difficulties that I have been in. For years I had felt all alone.  In this episode I also pick up from where I left off in my last episode and describe an incident that really set me off and brought me into a deep darkness. I was beaten for nothing really and felt that I could trust no one in life anymore. I am no longer in that deep darkness and would now like to share my story so that people may understand what is what that I and other people go through in life.  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.title: Hidden in the Jungle: Dark Side of Religious Life
episodes.description: I continue sharing my experiences from the religious life on this podcast. In today's episode I share the story when I was sent to a jungle area up in the mountains in the Philippines. At first I was under a superior who treated me well until he was replaces by a superior who loved to slap, humiliate, and physically beat members through the vow of "obedience." I had tried to do every thing in my religious life perfectly by the standards of my superiors yet I was always getting punished. I had wanted to leave but I did not know how. This is my story. Enjoy!  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.title: Santo AngHELL
episodes.description: In this podcast I talk about how there was a force of good and evil that was very much alive during my time as a religious brother.  There was one side of religious life that was truly Christian and there was another side of it that was Cultish and abusive.  The Cultish members tried to ruin my life and found pleasure in seeing my sufferings and the sufferings of others which caused me severe PTSD.  Being between the two sides of good and bad members in religious life was very difficult but I was able to hold on to HOPE with the help of good brothers and sisters.  In this podcast I lift up the good members, although not perfect, however, they did so much to help me on my road of healing.  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support

episodes.title: Response to Episode When Following God Feels like a Mistake
episodes.description: I am overwhelmed by the amount of people have reached out to me. I had to make a response to that episode because I want to be clear: I am not doing this to please people or as some sort of healing. I primarily want to do this because I believe that my story is something that can be shared with many people, particularly those who left religious life. Entering the religious life as a Catholic was so exciting but by the time I left I was so messed up. It has taken years for me to find peace. Now I want to share my peace and a piece of my mind on what happened in there.  ---   Support this podcast: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/ryan-anthony-hernandez/support
